required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Whole-body Vibration Training
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Whole-body Vibration Training on Biomarkers and Health Beliefs of Prefrail Older Adults: A Quasi-experimental Research

lead_sponsor.agency: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The whole-body vibration programme employed in this study partly improved the biomarkers and health beliefs of the prefrail community-dwelling older adults.

detailed_description.textblock: The experimental group participated in a 12-week whole-body vibration training that conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration at 12-Hz frequency and 3-mm amplitude each time

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for Grip strength
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 12 weeks (The experimental group participated training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of grip strength before and after 12 weeks of training

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for 15-foot walk test speed
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 12 weeks (The experimental group participated training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of 15-foot walk test speed before and after 12 weeks of training

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for One-leg standing test using the dominant leg with the eyes open
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 12 weeks (The experimental group participated training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of One-leg standing test with the eyes open before and after 12 weeks of training

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for Thirty-second chair stand test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 12 weeks (The experimental group participated training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of Thirty-second chair stand test before and after 12 weeks of training

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for Two-minute step test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 12 weeks (The experimental group participated training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration)
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of Two-minute step test before and after 12 weeks of training

primary_outcome.measure: Pretest and posttest results of the experimental and control groups for Health beliefs
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of health beliefs before and after 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of posttest ANCOVA of the experimental and control groups for biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: One-way ANCOVA was conducted using the groups as the independent variable and the pretest results and sex as covariate variables to assess the intervention effectiveness

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of posttest ANCOVA of the experimental and control groups for health beliefs
secondary_outcome.description: One-way ANCOVA was conducted using the groups as the independent variable and the pretest results and sex as covariate variables to assess the intervention effectiveness

arm_group.description: a 12-week whole-body vibration training that conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration at 12-Hz frequency and 3-mm amplitude each time.

intervention.description: The experimental group participated in a 12-week whole-body vibration training that was conducted 3 times per week, with 5-min continuous vibration at 12-Hz frequency and 3-mm amplitude each time. The control group were provided home DVDs on resistance exercise and manuals for preventing frailty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age of 65 years or older and living in a community
- Full consciousness and able to communicate verbally
- No severe cognitive disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Impaired mobility after recent surgery
- Major illness such as cancer
- Severe hearing impairment and inability to fully understand and follow instructions

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Taipei University of Nursing and Health Sciences
